Name.BusinessNameLine1: RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR MENTAL HYGIENE INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Conduct of studies, teaching, training and research into the causes, nature and treatment of diseases, disorders and defects affecting the mind, brain and nervous systems and to discover and apply more efficient measures of prevention, treatment and cure of nervous and mental hygiene disorders.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PLEASE SEE DESCRIPTION FOR FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1 ON SCHEDULE O.
IRS990.Description: NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH ("NIH") MENTAL HEALTH RESEARCH GRANT OBJECTIVES ARE TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF BASIC BIOLOGICAL AND BEHAVORIAL PROCESSES THAT UNDERLIE MENTAL AND BEHAVORIAL DISORDERS, AND OF PROCESSES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO MAINTAINING MENTAL HEALTH; TO IMPROVE METHODS OF RESEARCH RELEVANT TO THESE DISORDERS AND TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ON MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. AREAS OF RESEARCH SUPPORT ARE: NEUROSCIENCES INCLUDING MOLECULAR GENETICS, BEHAVIORIAL SCIENCES, EPIDEMIOLOGY, CLINICAL ASSESSMENT, ETIOLOGICAL STUDIES, TREATMENT, PREVENTION AND RESERACH ON HIV/AIDS BEHAVIOR.

Activity2.Description: NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH ("NIH") DRUG ABUSE AND ADDICTION RESEARCH GRANT OBJECTIVES ARE TO SUPPORT EPIDEMIOLOGIC, BASIC, CLINICAL, AND APPLIED RESEARCH TO DEVELOP NEW KNOWLEDGE AND APPROACHES RELATED TO THE PREVENTION, TREATMENT, ETIOLOGY, AND CONSEQUENCES OF DRUG ADDICTION, INCLUDING HIV/AIDS.

Activity3.Description: NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH ("NIH") AGING RESEARCH GRANT OBJECTIVES ARE TO ENCOURAGE BIOMEDICAL, SOCIAL AND BEHAVORIAL RESEARCH AND RESEACH TRAINING DIRECTED TOWARD GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE AGING PROCESS AND THE DISEASES, SPECIAL PROBLEMS, AND NEEDS OF PEOPLE AS THEY AGE; UNDERSTANDING THE BASIC BIOLOGICAL PROCESS OF AGING, IMPROVE THE ABILITIES OF HEALTH CARE PRACTITIONERS TO RESPOND TO THE DISEASES AND OTHER CLINICAL PROBLEMS OF OLDER PEOPLE; DEVELOP A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOCIAL, CULTURAL, ECONOMIC AND PSYCHOLOGICAL FACTORS THAT AFFECT BOTH THE PROCESS OF GROWING OLD AND THE PLACE OF OLDER PEOPLE IN SOCIETY.

AddressUS.AddressLine1: ONE GUSTAVE LEVY PL PO BOX 3500

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION HAS APPROXIMATELY 800 MEMBERS WHO ARE CLASSIFIED AS FOLLOWS: A. ACTIVE MEMBERS, B. CONTRIBUTING OR SUPPORTING MEMBERS, C. HONORARY MEMBERS. QUALIFICATIONS OF MEMBERS: A. ACTIVE MEMBERS ARE NEW YORK STATE OR FOUNDATION EMPLOYEES AT RESEARCH INSTITUTES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF MENTAL HYGIENE, WORKING AT LEAST HALF-TIME IN STATE GRADES 22 OR HIGHER, OR THE FOUNDATION EQUIVALENT, WHO ARE ACTIVELY ENGAGED IN CONDUCTING DIRECTLY OR ADMINISTERING MENTAL HYGIENE RESEARCH PROJECTS OR PROGRAMS. B. CONTRIBUTING OR SUPPORTING MEMBERS INCLUDE PERSONS WHO BY CONTRIBUTION, BEQUEST, GIFT, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRIBUTED TO THE PURPOSES OF THE FOUNDATION. C. HONORARY MEMBERS MAY INCLUDE FORMER MEMBERS OF EITHER OF THE PRECEDING CLASSES, OR ADDITIONAL PERSONS WHOM THE FOUNDATION MAY WISH TO RECOGNIZE OR HONOR BECAUSE OF PERSONAL ACHIEVEMENT OR PROFESSIONAL DISTINCTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ACTIVE MEMBERS ELECT CONTRIBUTING OR SUPPORTING MEMBERS, HONORARY MEMBERS AND CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ELECTION OF 12 OF THE 23 MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO SERVE FOUR-YEAR TERMS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ONLY DECISION THAT IS SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE MEMBERS IS THE DISSOLUTION OF THE FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE MANAGEMENT OF THE FOUNDATION AND REVIEWED BY THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THE FORM IS ALSO PRESENTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND THE BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND MEMBER CERTIFICATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHEREBY OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND ALL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE ORGANIZATION CONSISTENTLY MONITORS THE POLICY, PROVIDES REMINDERS OF ITS EXISTENCE AND THE OBLIGATION OF THOSE WITH A PERCEIVED OR ACTUAL CONFLICT TO PRESENT IT TO THE PROPER REPORTING AUTHORITY, AS PROVIDED FOR IN THE POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND ALL EMPLOYEES. THE COMMITTEE USES COMPARABLE SALARY DATA FROM AFFILIATED NEW YORK STATE AGENICES, THE RESEARCH INDUSTRY AND OTHER NON-PROFITS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION FILES ANNUAL REPORTS WITH THE CHARITIES BUREAU OF THE NEW YORK STATE ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE, ACCOMPANIED BY AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHICH ARE ACCESSIBLE BY THE PUBLIC AT THE BUREAU'S WEBSITE. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION ON REQUEST.

FORM 990, PART VII, SEC. A - COMPENSATION OF CERTAIN DIRECTORS: THE COMPENSATION PAID TO DIRECTORS STUART LINDER, DR. MICHAEL KOHN, DR. ABEL LAJTHA AND DR. EDMUND JENKINS WAS NOT FOR THEIR PARTICIPATION ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, RATHER FOR THEIR EFFORT IN CONDUCTING RESEARCH AND/OR PERFORMING ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS AS A FOUNDATION EMPLOYEE; THERE WAS NO OTHER COMPENSATION PAID TO ANY OF THE REMAINING DIRECTORS.
